column4: Guys, where do I throw in a script to ensure that the RTS of my card is set to 2346 on every boot. Right now, it defaults to off. I believe it was in rc.local somewhere. It has completely slipped my mind
Yeah. But that is the script exectued on user logout. Do you know the directory in which every script is executed in the given particular order on system startup
By I don't have access, I mean, I am too lazy to open up even the terminal :P
I think the factoid for it was !clone, but if I remember correctly, the commands in it don't work right.
I guess you could try them and see. If they don't give you an error, you should be okay.
Yeah, found them. Lets see if they work or not. Thans
Yup, doesn't work anymore. Invalid regex
on which command? The first or the second?
The first command, but I found a native solution. dpkg --get-selections, achieves exactly the same thing, without parsing
If you have the admin priv., you might want to update it :)
I don't. There are factoid submission instructions at https://wiki.ubuntu.com/UbuntuBots#Using%20Ubottu
Ahh, cool. I will see if I can do that once I am finished getting Intrepid installed :)
Intrepid has Ekiga 2, not 3, hence (I assume) him downloading.
